attributes.comment:
Re: USCIS-2006-0044

I am writing to express my disappointment with the proposed fee increases for
adoption-related petitions. As a couple currently working to adopt three orphans,
we are well acquainted with the already substantial fees required by the U.S.
Government to adopt orphaned children.

I feel that these significant increases will place extra hardship on families
struggling to come up with the already hefty petition and documentation fees
required. These children wait in orphanages without hope and desperate for loving
families. It is unwise to penalize families with inflated fees who are compelled to
adopt hurting children around the world.

Orphaned children adopted into U.S. families are a very important component of
our society. They will not be a burden to our society but instead will prove to be a
major asset to this nation. As recipients of such love and compassion, these
children will blossom, thrive and contribute greatly to this nation. They will be
outstanding, influential citizens who will work heartily for good. These children will
mature into the kind of citizens our nation needs. The beneficial contributions that
these children will make for future generations should compel the U.S.
Government to not make it more financially burdensome to incorporate them into
our families and society.

Thank you very much for your consideration,

Julie Armstrong
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Julie Armstrong
